poem:
**Starmer's Dance**

Three U-turns on a moonlit stage,  
A dance of doubt, step back, engage.  
Beneath the suits and watchful eyes,  
A flicker of hope, a compromise.  
Yet in the whirl, a leader spun,  
A silhouette against the sun.  
Diminished now in public's gaze,  
The cost of moves in shadowed plays.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Third U-turn in a month leaves Keir Starmer diminished After his third U-turn this month, Keir Starmer will hope he has done enough to avoid a humiliating first Commons defeat as prime minister on Tuesday, even if he is now a diminished figure in front of his party and the country. Over Wednesday night and Thursday, Starmer’s chief of staff, Morgan McSweeney, and the deputy PM, Angela Rayner, sat down with leading rebels and agreed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
